meanings.definition: Talking or tending to talk much or freely
meanings.sent1: She is known for being loquaciously chatty during our lunch breaks.
meanings.sent2: The loquaciously friendly neighbor greeted everyone on the street.
meanings.sent3: The loquaciously talkative parrot entertained the guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her loquaciously expressive gestures added life to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The loquaciously verbose professor captivated his students with stories.

meanings.sent1: The loquaciously loud speaker at the event annoyed many attendees.
meanings.sent2: She became loquaciously excited when discussing her favorite topic.
meanings.sent3: The loquaciously gossipy group shared rumors about the new student.
meanings.sent4: His loquaciously animated storytelling kept the children engaged for hours.
meanings.sent5: The loquaciously bubbly personality of the host made the party lively.
